result.execSummary:
The defendant Darla Louise Scheel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Darla Louise Scheel is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Darla Louise Scheel was found guilty of Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.

CORRECTION TO SENTENCING ENTRY OF 06-21-2017:

Defendant to pay all costs, surcharges and fees while on extended supervision on 14CF1422.  TO BE COLLECTED BY Department of Corrections.

Defendant Darla Louise Scheel in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant Darla Louise Scheel in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statements by:  ETHEL F.

Defendant sentenced to serve FOUR (4) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for FOUR (4) DAYS time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees WHILE ON EXTENDED SUPERVISION ON 14CF1422 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Darla Louise Scheel in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant Darla Louise Scheel in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State moved to REVOKE the DPA.  Defense and Defendant conceded that there is a FACTUAL basis for the REVOCATION.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Br. 33.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 21, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Darla Scheel in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant Darla Scheel in custody.  sdg

Defendant Darla Louise Scheel in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant Darla Louise Scheel in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and elements/Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.
Matter calendared for entry into DTC before Br. 33 on 02-24-2016 at 02:30 pm.  Status Conference calendared before Br. 47 is CANCELLED.  sdg

Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.

  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defense motion to dismiss Count 2, GRANTED by Court.  Defendant plead not guilty as to Count 1.
